content: * Suggest to change HCF to "Highest Common Factor", because probably some people don't know what the abbreviation stands for. Also, it seems more common for the CodinGame community to refer that to GCD ("Greatest Common Divisor") instead.

‚úÖ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I enjoyed coding it in C#.  It was a nice easy challenge.

‚úÖ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I liked this one, the (albeit somewhat random) edge cases make it hard enough to suit an easy puzzle vs a clash (I think it took me like 20+ mins?).

The tests are well made. The only caveat I have is that Validator 6 is testing for "lacking a coordinate in the input", not matching the corresponding test. Although this won't matter much because it is also tested in the testcase right after.

I also, like @Timinator, do not remember seen a puzzle similar enough to question the originality, even if computing a vector difference and a distance is not precisely a novelty.

‚úÖ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I enjoyed this puzzle. I have searched CG for other vector puzzles and I haven't found anything similar. The write-up is well done and the test cases are well designed. Nice job!

Very nice puzzle! I would classify this puzzle as "easy, but not as easy as you first think". Since that isn't a real category, I'm okay with easy.

I found it very tempting to let my code go in weird directions and I thoroughly enjoyed trying to keep my algorithm simple and straightforward.

Other than cedricdd's comment about stating the required precision, I'm not seeing any other issues.

Hi,

You probably should define how you want the distance to be rounded in the output part.

Goal
* Suggest to change "Captain X" to "Captain". You've asked me to "picture myself as an intrepid intergalactic navigator" instead of "picture Captain X as an intrepid intergalactic navigator". üòÇ

Input
* Both descriptions refer to the location of the ship in space.

Constraints
* Please change "len" to "length" (twice).

* Please mention that all coefficients in [[ship]] and [[nebula]] are integers.

Cases
* Please revise the tests to ensure greater similarity in coverage between each pair of test and validator, e.g.
   ‚Ä¢ Validator 2 features a leading space, but no other tests feature that.
   ‚Ä¢ Validators 1 and 4 feature a negative coefficient at the front, but no other tests feature that.

All pairs of cases should be refined.

Thanks.
Thank you @5DN1L, your detailed description of the issues made my work way more easier. And also captain X has been changed to captainüòÇ
Thank you @cedricdd, I forgot to mention the significant part about the output...
But I though it would be far more easier to be categorized as a Medium puzzle. So I went with Easy. The stated changes have been made. Are there any other changes required?

I should‚Äôve added this to my comment yesterday, but I might‚Äôve gotten a little lazy. I spent at least an hour or two redesigning my code until I had a solution that really worked for me. It was as if my code was looking at me, saying, ‚ÄúC‚Äômon man, you can do better!‚Äù I like a puzzle that gets under my skin than way.

‚ÄúEasy‚Äù is appropriate. 

I have no other suggested changes right now.
